sentences.sentence: Russia and Ukraine make their first major prisoner of war exchange since the last swap failed a week ago.

sentences.sentence: Hungary presses Ukraine to make further legal reforms to resolve a dispute over minority rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The European Union is stepping up pressure on Hungary ahead of the high-stakes summit on Thursday to agree on four years' worth of 50 billion euros of aid to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Released prisoners of war returning to home soil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Russia and Ukraine conducted their first major prisoner of war exchange on Wednesday since the previous swap failed a week ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Moscow and Kyiv said they handed over approximately 200 soldiers each.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So far, some 3,000 prisoners of war have reportedly been repatriated since the start of Russia's full-scale invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And Wednesday's events marked the 50th exchange.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: This after a Russian military transport plane allegedly carrying dozens of Ukrainian prisoners of war crashed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Moscow claims Ukrainian President Zelensky's forces shot it down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, Moscow held a church and memorial service for the Russian pilots who reportedly lost their lives in the crash. Ukrainian officials said that the swap the day of the crash had been cancelled and no evidence shows the POWs were on board.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And it is possible that the point at the top of the European Union on 8 December was the point that moved the question of the Ukrainian-Hungarian relations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But Hungary is not fully satisfied with the reforms, a potential sticking point as EU leaders meet on Thursday to try to convince Orbán to lift his veto on a 50 billion euro aid package for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We have just announced the guarantees that we can get back to the 2015 state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Hungary has made 11 specific requests to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They include restoring the status of the national school, allowing a high school diploma to be taken in Hungarian and enabling the use of the Hungarian language in public life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The European Union has stepped up pressure on Hungary ahead of the high-stakes summit

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: on Thursday to agree on four years' worth of 50 billion euros of aid to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In the last European Council meeting in December, Hungary vetoed the initiative.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Now, many member states have lost patience with Viktor Orban, systematically misusing his veto power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Now they are ready to act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We have never seen such an isolation for a new member state against other EU member states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And it really seems to be a test for the European Union on how much it can handle its internal disagreements.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Now, EU institutions and member states are trying desperately to find solutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Possible alternatives could be financing Kyiv outside of the EU's budget with the remaining 26 countries. Other countries are demanding that the EU strips Hungary of its voting rights by stepping up the so-called Article 7 process, a sanctions regime already in place against Budapest because of democratic backsliding.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We shall see whether the leaders will have enough patience to negotiate with Viktor Orbán or whether they will undertake this new way by using of Article 7, but it's just a speculation." Hungary earlier signalled it would be open to an agreement if the EU would allow an annual check-up on the Ukraine package.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This was rejected by other countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Budapest also demanded more of the EU funds for Hungary be unfrozen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The funds in total make up 20 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Orbán still has a kind of transactional logic, which means that if he receives good offers, it means that he can abandon his vetoism and obstivist approach in the decision-making process, but I don't think it cancelled the long-term problem.

sentences.sentence: And the long-term problem seems to be that the legal system and political system of Hungary seems to be unfit to the institutional structures and the values of the European Union. alle strutture istituzionali e ai valori dell'Unione Europea.
